courses.title: eecs 281
courses.name: data structures and algorithms
courses.description: eecs 281 is an introductory course in data structures and algorithms at the undergraduate level. the objective of the course is to present a number of fundamental techniques to solve common programming problems. for each of these problems, we will determine an abstract specification for a solution and examine one or more potential representations to implement the abstract specification, focusing on those with significant advantages in time/space required to solve large problem instances. when appropriate, we will consider special cases of a general problem that admit particularly elegant solutions.

courses.title: eecs 482
courses.name: introduction to operating systems
courses.description: eecs 482 is an introductory course in operating systems at the undergraduate level. the objective of the course is to present fundamental concepts and techniques used in modern operating systems. topics include process management, memory management, file systems, and i/o systems. the course emphasizes the design and implementation of system software components and their interactions.

courses.title: eecs 370
courses.name: introduction to computer architecture
courses.description: eecs 370 is an introductory course in computer architecture at the undergraduate level. the course covers the basic principles of computer architecture and organization, including instruction set architecture, processor design, memory hierarchy, and input/output systems. the objective is to understand how computers execute programs and how various components work together to provide functionality.

courses.title: eecs 484
courses.name: database management systems
courses.description: eecs 484 is an introductory course in database management systems at the undergraduate level. the course covers the fundamental concepts of database design, implementation, and management. topics include data modeling, relational databases, sql, transaction management, and database security. the objective is to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to design and implement database systems.

courses.title: eecs 203
courses.name: discrete mathematics
courses.description: eecs 203 is an introductory course in discrete mathematics at the undergraduate level. the course covers fundamental topics in discrete mathematics, including logic, set theory, combinatorics, graph theory, and discrete probability. the objective is to provide students with the mathematical foundation necessary for computer science and engineering.

courses.title: datasci 204
courses.name: introduction to data science
courses.description: datasci 204 is an introductory course in data science at the undergraduate level. the course covers fundamental concepts and techniques in data science, including data collection, data cleaning, data visualization, and statistical analysis. the objective is to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to analyze and interpret data to make informed decisions.

courses.title: eecs 376
courses.name: foundations of computer science
courses.description: eecs 376 is an introductory course in the foundations of computer science at the undergraduate level. the course covers fundamental topics in theoretical computer science, including automata theory, formal languages, computability, and complexity theory. the objective is to provide students with a deep understanding of the theoretical underpinnings of computer science.

courses.title: ling 441
courses.name: computational linguistics
courses.description: ling 441 is an introductory course in computational linguistics at the undergraduate level. the course covers fundamental concepts and techniques in computational linguistics, including natural language processing, syntactic parsing, semantic analysis, and machine translation. the objective is to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to analyze and process natural language data.

courses.title: phil 340
courses.name: minds and machines
courses.description: phil 340 is an introductory course in the philosophy of mind and artificial intelligence at the undergraduate level. the course covers fundamental topics in the philosophy of mind, including the nature of consciousness, the mind-body problem, and the implications of artificial intelligence for our understanding of the mind. the objective is to provide students with a philosophical framework for thinking about the nature of the mind and the potential of artificial intelligence.

courses.title: eecs 492
courses.name: introduction to artificial intelligence
courses.description: eecs 492 is an introductory course in artificial intelligence at the undergraduate level. the course covers fundamental concepts and techniques in artificial intelligence, including search algorithms, knowledge representation, machine learning, and robotics. the objective is to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to design and implement intelligent systems.

courses.title: eecs 491
courses.name: distributed systems
courses.description: eecs 491 is an introductory course in distributed systems at the undergraduate level. the course covers fundamental concepts and techniques in distributed systems, including communication protocols, distributed algorithms, fault tolerance, and security. the objective is to provide students with the knowledge and skills necessary to design and implement distributed systems.

courses.title: rob 101
courses.name: computational linear algebra
courses.description: rob 101 is an introductory course in computational linear algebra at the undergraduate level. the course covers fundamental topics in linear algebra, including matrix operations, vector spaces, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors. the objective is to provide students with the mathematical foundation necessary for applications in robotics, computer graphics, and machine learning.
